hedline.hl1: National News Briefs; White House Is Accused Of Hindering Inquiries

abstract.p: Robert W Ray, Whitewater prosecutor, tells federal judge that lawyers at White House deliberately make it difficult for investigators to seek subpoenaed documents (S)

block.p: Robert W. Ray, the independent prosecutor investigating Whitewater matters, has told a federal judge that lawyers at the White House deliberately made it difficult for investigators seeking subpoenaed documents.

In a highly unusual action, Mr. Ray's office intervened in a civil case in which it had no formal role. In a letter to Judge Royce C. Lamberth, Jay Apperson, a deputy independent counsel, wrote that the White House was being misleading when one of its former lawyers, Michelle Peterson, testified that it was the practice of the White House to be helpful to investigators.

Robert W. Ray, the independent prosecutor investigating Whitewater matters, has told a federal judge that lawyers at the White House deliberately made it difficult for investigators seeking subpoenaed documents.

In a highly unusual action, Mr. Ray's office intervened in a civil case in which it had no formal role. In a letter to Judge Royce C. Lamberth, Jay Apperson, a deputy independent counsel, wrote that the White House was being misleading when one of its former lawyers, Michelle Peterson, testified that it was the practice of the White House to be helpful to investigators.

The Apperson letter, made public today by the court, was provided for a lawsuit by Judicial Watch, a conservative group that is suing the White House, saying officials there concealed thousands of e-mail messages sought by investigators.
